cyclone.name: HANNA
cyclone.current_location: about 370 mi ESE of Port O'Connor, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking west-northwest across the north-western Gulf of Mexico toward the central-south Texas coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Port O'Connor / Corpus Christi, TX

weather_observation.watch_coast: San Luis Pass to High Island, Texas
weather_observation.warning_coast: Port Mansfield to San Luis Pass, Texas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Texas coast from Port Mansfield northward to High Island and portions of the Louisiana coast
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤13%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusts 25–35 mph possible Friday night into Saturday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–2 ft possible along the Upper Texas coast with dangerous surf and rip currents.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches of rainfall possible with isolated higher amounts, creating a risk of flash flooding in the Galveston/Houston area Friday night through Saturday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas, strong rip currents, and occasional squally rainbands may disrupt port operations.
